page.title: 18EAST HAILEY
page.content: {SQUARE 3810 A striking feature is the contrast between land use on the Eastern and Western halves of the square. To the West the emphasis is residential but to the East is mainly recreational. {WESTERN AREA: The{HOUSING}varies from small terraced houses built at the turn of the century (the earliest dating back to 1893) to Council houses built in the 1950s and 60s. Public and other{SERVICES}provided include the John Warner secondary school, a local Post Office, two public houses (the 'Old Highway Tavern' and 'The Rye House') and small corner shops.
